name: Grandma's Baking Powder Biscuits
author: IMACOOKY1
summary: This is my grandmother's biscuit recipe. It is my all-time favorite and has a really good flavor to it. Be sure not to roll out too thin, you want high biscuits! I usually just pat out the dough to the desired thickness, usually 1/2 inch.
directions: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, cream of tartar, and salt into a bowl
Use a pastry cutter to chop vegetable shortening into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs
Whisk egg and milk together in a separate bowl and slowly add milk mixture to flour mixture, stirring as you pour, until dough is moistened and well-mixed
Drop dough by spoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until biscuits have risen and are golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes
